description: Describes the specified attribute of the specified AMI. You can specify only one attribute at a time.

parameters.name: Attribute
parameters.description: The AMI attribute. Note: The blockDeviceMapping attribute is deprecated. Using this attribute returns the Client.AuthFailure error. To get information about the block device mappings for an AMI, use the  DescribeImages action.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the AMI.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: RamdiskId
nested_items.description: The RAM disk ID.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: SriovNetSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether enhanced networking with the Intel 82599 Virtual Function interface is enabled.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: TpmSupport
nested_items.description: If the image is configured for NitroTPM support, the value is v2.0.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: LastLaunchedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 date-time format, when the AMI was last used to launch an EC2 instance. When the AMI is used to launch an instance, there is a 24-hour delay before that usage is reported.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: ImdsSupport
nested_items.description: If v2.0, it indicates that IMDSv2 is specified in the AMI. Instances launched from this AMI will have HttpTokens automatically set to required so that, by default, the instance requires that IMDSv2 is used when requesting instance metadata. In addition, HttpPutResponseHopLimit is set to 2. For more information, see Configure the AMI in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: DeregistrationProtection
nested_items.description: Indicates whether deregistration protection is enabled for the AMI.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The attribute value. The value is case-sensitive.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI.

nested_items.name: LaunchPermissions
nested_items.description: The launch permissions.

nested_items.name: OrganizationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an organization.

nested_items.name: OrganizationalUnitArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an organizational unit (OU).

nested_items.name: UserId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_items.name: Group
nested_items.description: The name of the group.

nested_items.name: ProductCodes
nested_items.description: The product codes.

nested_items.name: ProductCodeId
nested_items.description: The product code.

nested_items.name: ProductCodeType
nested_items.description: The type of product code.

nested_items.name: BlockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: The block device mapping entries.

nested_items.name: DeleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination. For more information, see Preserving Amazon EBS volumes on instance termination in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). For gp3, io1, and io2 volumes, this represents the number of IOPS that are provisioned for the volume. For gp2 volumes, this represents the baseline performance of the volume and the rate at which the volume accumulates I/O credits for bursting.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The ID of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: VolumeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the volume, in GiBs. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume size. If you specify a snapshot, the default is the snapshot size. You can specify a volume size that is equal to or larger than the snapshot size.
gp2 and gp3: 1 - 16,384 GiB.
st1 and sc1: 125 - 16,384 GiB.
standard: 1 - 1024 GiB.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type. For more information, see Amazon EBS volume types in the Amazon EBS User Guide.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: of the customer managed KMS key to use for EBS encryption.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s.

nested_items.name: OutpostArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Outpost on which the snapshot is stored.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the encryption state of an EBS volume is changed while being restored from a backing snapshot. The effect of setting the encryption state to true depends on the volume origin (new or from a snapshot), starting encryption state, ownership, and whether encryption by default is enabled. For more information, see Amazon EBS encryption in the Amazon EBS User Guide.

nested_items.name: NoDevice
nested_items.description: To omit the device from the block device mapping, specify an empty string. When this property is specified, the device is removed from the block device mapping regardless of the assigned value.

nested_items.name: DeviceName
nested_items.description: The device name (for example, /dev/sdh or xvdh).

nested_items.name: VirtualName
nested_items.description: The virtual device name ( ephemeral``N). Instance store volumes are numbered starting from 0. An instance type with 2 available instance store volumes can specify mappings for ``ephemeral0 and ephemeral1. The number of available instance store volumes depends on the instance type. After you connect to the instance, you must mount the volume.
